item.title: How to Install Apps Using Terminal in Ubuntu 22.10
item.description: Using terminal is the easiest way to install apps in linux Installing appsTo install apps use the following command: $ sudo apt install packageName Replace packageName with the name of the package Uninstalling appsUsing removeTo uninstall apps use the following command: $ sudo apt remove packageNamudo/ Replace packageName with the name of the package or Using purge$ sudo apt purge packageName Replace packageName with the name of the package Difference between remove & purgeThe primary difference being ‘remove‘ and ‘purge‘ is that ‘remove‘ only gets rid of the package leaving any configuration files untouched.
